alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lake and northwestern Volusia Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near DeLeon Springs, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... DeLand, DeLeon Springs, Barberville, DeLand Airport and Forest Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
